message: Excited to kick off the the 115th Congress and Make America Great Again! #TN04 #MAGA #OpeningDay

Today, the first day of the new Congress, we’re working on improving veterans health care. To fix persistent problems at the Veterans Administration, I’ll vote for my Tennessee colleague Dr. Phil Roe's bill to ensure the safety of inventory at VA hospitals and another to enforce discipline in the dysfunctional bureaucracy. With a new President in office, I’m confident change will finally come to an institution that has failed too many in the Volunteer State.
Signing my Oath of Office for the 115th Congress. Honored to continue serving the Fourth Congressional District of Tennessee #TN04 #TennesseeTuesday

As this young woman discovered, an Obamacare plan is just an expensive piece of paper. Ironically, to solve her chronic medical problem, she negotiated directly with a health care provider in the private market, where competition and price transparency drive  down costs. But she's still paying high premiums for Obamacare. Imagine the savings, if we simply repealed the failing law.

Last night, I voted on the Midnight Rules Relief Act to stop lame-duck Presidents from implementing last-minute regulations. This would be an important step in ensuring the American people have a say in harmful rules and regulations that cost our economy billions of dollars every year.

Only the worst of the worst jihadists remain in Guantanamo. Many of the released detainees return to terrorism. Most of the 9/11 attackers were from Saudi Arabia! This President is inflicting as much damage as possible before leaving office, again putting politics ahead of the safety and security of the American people. A new Commander-in-Chief couldn’t come soon enough.

My heart goes out to victims of arson, and I’m eager to see a full review of the disaster and response, including any breach of policy. To improve federal policy, my responsibility on the House Agriculture Committee, I voted for a bill to better identify and manage high-risk zones, as well as to dedicate more public resources to the effort, in order to protect communities like Gatlinburg.
Today is National Law Enforcement Appreciation Day. Please join me in honoring our nation's law enforcement men and women by taking a moment to #ThankACop and #SupportBlue #TakeTheLead2017 #TN04

The Volunteer State has a proud military tradition, and Tennessee’s Fourth District lies at the center of the Aerospace and Defense Technology Corridor that includes Fort Campbell, Redstone Arsenal, Arnold Air Force Base, and Oak Ridge National Laboratory. I’m honored to serve the patriotic men and women who call our district home, and eager to get to work in the new Congress, in partnership with a new Administration, on the most urgent security matters facing the United States.

Last night, I had the pleasure of meeting two outstanding Tennessee truckers. Brad Coffey (left) from Murfreesboro and Gary Helms (right) from Cleveland. Thank you, gentleman, for being a part of America's Road Team! #TN04 #AmericanTruckingAssociation

“A thoughtful, consistent advocate for military members and their families, Congressman DesJarlais is a welcome addition to the House Armed Services Committee,” said Chairman Mac Thornberry. “He brings a wealth of experience from the Foreign Affairs Committee, as well as strong conviction that American leadership is the linchpin of global security. I look forward to working with him to ensure our military is properly funded, spending its resources wisely, and above all prepared to respond to rising threats around the world.”

As both a physician and Representative for Tennessee families at risk, I'm glad to see Congressional oversight has paid off, positively impacting many Americans' health and peace of mind. Just a few months ago at a House Oversight Committee hearing,  I  questioned Mylan's CEO about possible price-gouging.

The President’s health care law has failed. Millions initially lost their private insurance plans. Millions more are losing them as state exchanges crumble and employers drop coverage. Premiums and deductibles have skyrocketed, while new taxes and regulations are destroying small businesses and jobs. Obamacare’s price tag is double what its supporters promised, yet 30 million will remain uninsured. The law even cuts Medicare for seniors. Repealing it is an excellent first step to health care reform, followed by a plan that emphasizes lower costs, greater choice and better care for all Americans.

The Tennessee walking horse industry has made enormous strides to correct its training practices. Despite the one-sided story from opponents, industry professionals are making progress all the time, as fans expect them to. We want what's best for horses and a popular Tennessee tradition. But this latest midnight regulation could lead to its demise. I'm working with our state's delegation and the new Administration to protect the sport and also famed Tennessee walking horses.
Today, nearly 50 years later, we celebrate the life and legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., a man who never doubted the power of a dream. #MLKDay

For the first time in decades, average life expectancy in the U.S. dropped in 2015. Substance abuse and suicide are on the rise. But experts say, because a number of health problems are on the rise, it’s difficult to pinpoint the precise cause of rising mortality rates. This, despite the Administration’s most expansive new regulation. Obamacare is a failure by the most the important measure: our health. Read my oped about solutions in the The Daily Caller.
It was a pleasure meeting Kaya Lyle today. Kaya is on Capitol Hill to bring awareness to the benefits service dogs can provide for veterans with PTSD. #PAWSAct #DogsForVeterans #KayaCare

You probably heard about Chelsea Manning. Obama commuted the sentence of the spy who released sensitive national security documents to WikiLeaks. Lost in the uproar was the President's pardon for a terrorist who once attempted to escape prison and has refused to renounce violence.
Pre-Inauguration Open House with Tennessee's Finest  #TN04

Glad I could help this patriot from Murfreesboro, Tennessee, attend Donald J. Trump's Inauguration today. The real excitement is in the anticipation of all we're going to accomplish with a new President!

In Tennessee, we’re excited for the next four years, even the next few weeks, as Donald J. Trump has proven himself a tireless advocate for the principles and policies that will Make America Great Again. He’s a hardworking pragmatist, who will do his best to represent every one of us. In Congress, I’m looking forward to helping President Trump achieve goals we all share: a thriving economy and safe, secure nation.
So grateful to have my family in town for the Inauguration! #MAGA #TN04

Overreaching federal bureaucracies are a big reason Tennessee rejected another four years of far-left, liberal governance in the White House. President Donald J. Trump's hiring freeze is only a first step to reforming the civil service, where agencies make their own rules, flout others that most private sector employees must follow, and spend far beyond the public's means. A more efficient effective federal workforce would reward the best employees and allow business and jobs to flourish.

The largest ever federal investment, $7 billion, produced no results at failing public schools, according to the U.S. Department of Education, which did not track how schools spent the money, most of which went to bureaucrats and administrators. Our kids deserve better than empty promises!
President Donald J. Trump is announcing "immediate construction of a border wall" right now -- to save lives on both sides of the southern border.

Violent storms are ripping across the South. Tennessee has had its share. Because of its number of strong wind events, Nashville earned "windiest city" in the United States last year, a dangerous distinction. TN.gov and FEMA Federal Emergency Management Agency have information about how to protect yourself and your property.

The study names Barack Obama's executive amnesty and tricky recess appointments as his biggest failures before the Court. In 2016, his own appointees joined 10 unanimous decisions against the former President. You'd have to go back to Zachary Taylor in the 19th Century to find a worse record than the "constitutional scholar." Guess who had the best record in modern times? Ronald Reagan.

President Donald J. Trump's orders are within his authority under existing law and long overdue, representing the first and foremost responsibility of the federal government: Americans' safety and  security. International gangs operating across the border have created a deadly drug crisis, terrorism is a clear threat, and it’s  past time we had a chief executive who fulfills his duty.

ISIS, al Qaeda and other terrorist organizations have demonstrated their intent to exploit U.S. security gaps, especially lax refugee and visa screening, to attack civilian targets. Temporarily halting insecure programs, while the Administration strengthens security to protect American citizens from the threat of Islamic terrorism, is a necessary step. The new Homeland Security Director has the experience and understanding to execute the orders, which the President promised to deliver and current law supports.
Thank you, everyone, for your prayers, phone calls and messages, following the passing of my father.
These early moves are crucial to providing ObamaCare’s hardest hit victims with quick relief, making it easier for Americans to buy the health insurance plans they want.

Almost every year, the federal government sets a new record for pages of rules and regulations, a big reason why small businesses are disappearing! For every new regulation, an agency should eliminate AT LEAST two old, outdated ones to create more jobs and economic growth.  Washington needs to get out of the way of Tennessee entrepreneurs and innovators.
What do you think of Donald J. Trump's Supreme Court pick?
Great news! Tennessee leads nation in small business job growth!

Budget cuts have forced Tennessee troops to deploy more frequently with inferior equipment, placing additional burdens on them and their families. With so many complex threats around the world, I’m grateful for the opportunity to improve their tools and training, requiring more streamlined and cost-effective programs.

This General Motors announcement is good for employees at the Spring Hill, Tennessee, plant in the Fourth District -- and for all the mechanics, automotive engineers and toolmakers who service our state's auto industry. January's jobs report was also a good one.

The new Department of Homeland Security chief has a plan to finish the wall, already working in some areas along the Southern Border. We also need better technology, more border agents and stronger enforcement of immigration laws to secure the country. General John Kelly, who oversaw counter-narcotics and human trafficking at Southern Command, has the experience to do the job.
The Falcons have the No. 1 scoring offense. The Patriots have the No. 1 scoring defense.

Barack Obama won a Nobel Prize for his promise to end military conflicts, but after withdrawing U.S. forces from Iraq, he gradually increased them to correct his strategic error there, as well as in Syria, Libya, Yemen, even the Pacific. At the same time, he pursued funding cuts and forced a series of budget crises that depleted military strength and morale. As a new member of the House Armed Services Committee, I'm working to restore our troops' equipment and confidence.

Essentially, a federal judge ruled that foreign nationals have the same constitutional rights as U.S. citizens, the right to enter our country at will, and the President has no legal authority, even for national security reasons, to restrict refugees or a class of alien, although Congress has made that responsibility clear. The decision sets a dangerous precedent, which undermines the very idea of our nation!

Immigration and Customs Enforcement regularly releases criminal aliens, many who commit more crimes, including murder. ICE cites a Supreme Court ruling that prohibits holding foreign nationals indefinitely, but the agency often releases detainees by its own discretion, sometimes more than once. In one tragic case, ICE refused to detain an alien charged with vehicular manslaughter, who then escaped justice.

I voted for legislation to increase troop numbers, their pay and readiness. As a new member of the House Armed Services Committee, I'm also working to restore the Army, Navy, Air Force and Marines to full strength to protect our soldiers in harm's way, as well as U.S. national security.
Even Democrats know Obamacare isn't working.

This is really simple: The Constitution and federal law grant the President ample authority to police U.S. borders and deny entry to foreign citizens for national security reasons. They have no constitutional right to enter the country, and states do not have standing to sue on behalf of third parties. Judges do not have the same information or political power to make foreign policy decisions as the Commander-in-Chief.

If Barack Obama's economy had lived up to his own forecasts, it would be a trillion dollars bigger today. It's actually over two trillion smaller than it should be, according to historical norms, because his Big Government recipe of taxes, fees and regulation punished business and employment. Optimism is up, and in Congress' first few weeks, I've voted to cancel last-minute Obama regulations that threatened to destroy jobs and investment. We're going to get this economy moving again, and middle-class incomes back on track.

Another wrinkle to "leading from behind" -- the former President's failed foreign policy. U.S. economic freedom trails more than a dozen countries, including Ireland, Chile and Canada, the result of government over-spending and record debt, which doubled to almost $20 trillion over the last eight years. Federal debt and taxes concentrate power in Washington, D.C., create bureaucratic cronyism, and burden small businesses and middle-class families without high-powered lobbyists. It's time for the United States to blaze a new trail to economic liberty.

Blue Cross Blue Shield already exited three of Tennessee’s Obamacare exchanges, due to unsustainable costs under the failed health care law. Humana’s planned exit will leave many in our state with ZERO insurance options in the local exchange. As a primary care physician and father, my focus in this Congress is repealing this government-run disaster, and helping Tennesseans to secure better, more affordable health care plans.

I met with Donald J. Trump at The White House today. I told the President, "Tennessee is fully behind you... We know that health care and tax reform have to be done this year. We like the work you're doing, and we need you to help us continue to do it." With Dr. Tom Price in charge of HHS, we're that much closer to Obamacare repeal. The President also announced more jobs are coming back to the U.S. and savings for taxpayers.

In the new Congress, I’ve voted to disapprove over a dozen harmful “midnight” regulations, which the outgoing administration rushed to publish without a thought to their impact on jobs and the economy, or our constitutional rights. The President has already signed several resolutions into law, and issued orders to prevent a nearly $3 billion loss to the economy.

Very productive meeting at the White House with President Donald J. Trump and VP Mike Pence. We're working hard to help Tennesseans afford better health care, and to cut taxes to allow Americans to save more money, invest, start businesses, families, and create jobs!

Washington, Lincoln and FDR consistently make up the top three. Eisenhower and Grant have been rising in the presidential rankings. Reagan is finally getting his due from liberal historians, as the politics surrounding his presidency subside. But politics have also driven Andrew Jackson downward. Who's your favorite U.S. president?

After eight years of high taxes, regulation, and obstruction in the White House, Congress and a new President are hard at work removing bureaucratic barriers, harmful fees, mandates and more, from the path of opportunity.

Duracell and Wacker Chemical are two major employers -- leading global companies -- in Bradley County, Tennessee, where our high-skilled workforce and business-friendly environment are creating great opportunities!

New VA Secretary David Shulkin pledged yesterday to get rid of VA employees who deserve to be fired for legitimate issues. There is no excuse for substandard care for our nation’s veterans. Unacceptable wait times, a lack of specialty care providers, and poor treatment of veterans seeking care is shameful and will not be tolerated.

In my travels across Tennessee this week,  high-tech employers told me about a shortage of skilled technicians to fill good jobs. Tennessee College of Applied Technology, where I met passionate instructors, is training them to meet the demands of modern industry. Well done!

The former president refused to recognize "Islamic terror," also using a less common term to describe its most dangerous practitioner, ISIS, another distraction from his national security failures. Our troops need the proper tools, as well terminology, to identify and defeat the enemy.
Congrats to Columbia's own Austin Tyler Jones. The singer-songwriter and entrepreneur also makes a mean cup of coffee at Muletown Roasted Coffee on the Square.

According to the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics by 2018 there will be 1.2 million unfilled jobs in (STEM) and Tennessee College of Applied Technology at Murfreesboro-Smyrna Campus is at the forefront of making sure Tennesseans are equipped for those jobs.

I was proud to attend President Donald J. Trump's first address to Congress on behalf of Tennessee's 4th District. I support the President’s plan for stronger borders and vetting of foreign nationals from terror-prone countries. As a member of the House Armed Services Committee, I’m working with President Trump to rebuild our military.

EPA personnel, acting anonymously to manipulate public sentiment, hired expensive P.R. firms to create third-party websites and social media, a disturbing trend of government secrecy and partisanship that undermines confidence in our civil service.  This week, I voted for the latest in a series of House bills to stop agency misconduct and overreach. The Regulatory Integrity Act would forbid civil service bureaucrats from organizing “covert propaganda” and require transparent record-keeping of public communications.

Obamacare has sent health care and taxpayer costs soaring, centralized decision-making power in Washington, and harmed small business and jobs. A patient-centered alternative should encourage affordability, choice, and free the economy to create more opportunities to save and invest in health care. For instance, I sponsored a bill to end anti-trust exemptions for insurance companies. What do you think a plan to repeal and replace Obamacare should include?

Middle Tennessee State University (MTSU) finished the regular season as outright champions and set a new C-USA record for most conference wins in a single season. Congrats to the team. Good luck in the tournament!

The President issued a new order to halt travel from certain terror-prone countries, until stronger vetting is in place. Undoubtedly, opponents will challenge the common-sense order to protect national security, but we must forge ahead with changes to keep the country safe. Open borders and privileges of U.S. citizenship for foreign nationals also put our sovereignty at risk.

Great February jobs report, which exceeded economists' expectations. Growth is spread across industries and companies of all sizes. Let's keep the positive momentum going with more smart tax and regulatory reforms:   "Employment in the private sector surged by 298,000 for the month, with goods producers adding 106,000, ADP and Moody's Analytics said. Construction jobs swelled by 66,000 and manufacturing added 32,000."

Secretary Kelly confirmed that under the former administration a very small percentage of the laws on the books were being enforced regarding illegal immigration. Since President Trump took office, they have begun to enforce these laws and we are already seeing up to a 50% reduction in illegals entering the country.

Terrorists who make war on the United States should go to military not civilian prison. Granting enemy combatants the same rights as U.S. citizens in American courts endangers our national security. Guantanamo is a safe, legal alternative to Barack Obama's catch-and-release program for jihadists.

The federal government is prohibited from forcing states to support federal programs with state revenues. Yet the federal government continues to shift the costs of resettling refugees, many of whom draw public assistance long after arriving in Tennessee, to local taxpayers. In its lawsuit, Tennessee, which opted out of the refugee program in 2007, argues the federal government is violating the Constitution's Tenth Amendment.

I'll appear with Donald J. Trump in Nashville, Tennessee, today to celebrate Andrew Jackson's birthday, another historic election in 2016, the progress we've made, and the progress we're going to make with the help of proud patriots across the country.
The judge's ruling is disgraceful. This will not stand.

During my listening tour across the Fourth District, many veterans spoke to me about federal health care’s broken promises. This week, I’ll vote for the VA Accountability First Act to improve access to quality care. We should hire the best doctors and managers, and remove those who abuse the system. Fortunately, we have a new president who's serious about reform, and Tennessee's Dr. Phil Roe is chairman of the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs.

Budget cuts have forced Tennessee troops to deploy more frequently with inferior equipment, placing additional burdens on them and their families. On the Armed Services Committee, I’m helping to provide our troops with the resources they need to be successful.

It was a pleasure speaking with the President on Air Force One about Obamacare repeal. We're working to reduce patient and taxpayer costs, as well as to improve outcomes for everyone. A freer insurance market, incentives to save and invest in health care in a growing economy, and more medical innovation are all keys to reform.

The VA and Social Security Administration have been adding many vets and seniors -- who simply need help filling out financial forms -- to the FBI's National Instant Criminal Background Check System, preventing them from purchasing firearms. It's an abuse of the list and a violation their Second Amendment rights, not to mention due process rights.
Neil Gorsuch’s Supreme Court confirmation hearing begins today. I believe he will be a great replacement for the late Justice Scalia.
The natural gas revolution is a green revolution, significantly reducing U.S. emissions, and it didn't require Obama's unconstitutional Paris Climate Agreement either!
St. Baldrick's Foundation raises awareness of childhood cancer.  Middle Tennessee members stopped by my office to ROCK THE BALD!
Severe storms hit Tennessee hard the last couple days, and more could be on the way. Everyone, please be safe.

Is Henry Sanchez really undocumented? His name is all over the news. Police charged him. He's registered at a Maryland high school. His name appears on other documents granting him benefits of U.S. residency, despite being a candidate for deportation. He's not "undocumented" and "sanctuary cities" seem to be sanctuaries for criminal aliens only.

Obamacare has cost the country jobs and quality health care. Tennessee has experienced the worst, and since 2010 I’ve fought for repeal. As currently written, however, the American Health Care Act keeps many of the same policies responsible for high premiums, which would continue to rise. While we made important changes to solve the problem of Obamacare, more are necessary, and I appreciate the President’s commitment to reform that empowers patients and protects taxpayers. The process, though difficult, has clarified what we must do to lower health care costs, expand access, cut taxes and reduce spending. To get it right, we’re ready to work even harder.

The costs of illegal immigration, in large part due to sanctuary cities that harbor criminal aliens, amount to billions of dollars every year in police and court costs, other public services, and more border agents to counteract lax enforcement in places like Los Angeles and San Francisco. The Justice Department is right to freeze federal funding until they cooperate with detainer notices.

Wow. Great news. Small business job growth in Tennessee is up 4.2 percent, leading the nation. To put that in perspective, growth is up 2 percent in Georgia, taking the number two spot. Paychex reports our state's start-up incubators and expanding auto sector are behind the surge. Also, low taxes and regulation. And hardworking Tennesseans!

Retired Maj. Gen. Gus Hargett is a staunch advocate for the National Guard and one of the most widely respected Tennesseans I have had the pleasure of knowing. He has more than 47 years of military service and next month will step down as president of the National Guard Association of the United States - NGAUS.
Today is National Vietnam War Veterans Day. Please help me thank and honor all who selflessly served and sacrificed.

Remember when, under the previous administration, economic figures were always "unexpectedly" falling short of economists' predictions? Now they're unexpectedly soaring higher, beating the forecasts. I'm not surprised. Congress and the White House are working together to unleash American energy, manufacturing, and innovation.

Just five countries of the 28-member NATO alliance meet their financial obligations under the treaty. The results have been predictable: increased Russian aggression in Eastern Europe. President Donald J. Trump and his team are taking our obligations -- and those of our allies -- seriously.

More prime working-age people, especially women, are re-entering the labor market. The employment-to-population ratio rose to its highest level since 2009, a good indicator of economic confidence. Small and medium-sized businesses are seeing the most job growth, and wages are up almost 3% over last year.

Years of budget uncertainty and "leading from behind" -- the notion that foreign adversaries will reward U.S. retreat -- have decreased military readiness, our forces' ability to respond rapidly to threats. I voted to stop troop reductions, improve equipment repair, and reduce waste at the Pentagon.
What would you ask Chinese President Xi Jinping?

Before she was spreading classified intelligence for political purposes, Susan Rice orchestrated the Obama Administration's  response to Benghazi, which she claimed was a spontaneous event, and the Bowe Bergdahl prisoner swap with the Taliban. Bergdahl still faces charges for desertion and endangering U.S. troops in Afghanistan.

At The White House today, President Donald J. Trump honored wounded warrior Sal Gonzalez of Murfreesboro, Tennessee. I voted this week to extend the Veterans Choice program, allowing vets confronting long wait times to seek care outside the VA.

Neil Gorsuch, a constitutionalist and defender of individual rights, will be sworn in Monday. It's a victory for small-government conservatives and also President Donald J. Trump, who fulfilled his promise to nominate a well-qualified replacement for Antonin Scalia. Gorsuch shined at confirmation hearings and will make a great Supreme Court justice.

I've always said, "enforce the laws we have on the books," and that's what we're seeing today: prioritized removal of criminal aliens convicted of crimes, everything from armed robbery to drunk driving and larceny. ICE is targeting drug dealers and human traffickers. Attorney General Sessions is unclogging a backlog of deportation cases, and illegal crossings along the border are way down. Enforcement is an effective deterrent -- and so is a wall!

The Obama Administration stymied a congressional investigation into IRS harassment of religious and conservative groups, an affront to our democracy and potential crime. How high did it go? Under new leadership, the Justice Department should re-examine the case.

Under Barack Obama, ISIS spread across the Middle East, including Afghanistan, while he also restricted our military's ability to engage the enemy. Our new president has unshackled our armed forces and granted commanders the  authority they need to defeat radical Islamic terrorists.
Happy Easter to you and your family!

Venezuela, with huge oil reserves, should be a rich nation. In fact, it was, until socialists took over. Under Nicolas Maduro, the government has slipped further towards tyranny, because socialism's economic failures always require more centralized control, and less democracy. Political cronies and bureaucrats have created a near-famine.
Some wise words from Winston Churchill on Tax Day.

The Obama Administration's open-border policies attracted a wave of "unaccompanied minors" from Central America, a boon for MS-13 recruitment in the U.S. The violent gang preys on new arrivals and has exploded across the country. The Trump Administration is accelerating deportations of criminal aliens -- enforcing the law. Our new Attorney General is making MS-13's destruction a top priority at the Justice Department.

Remember when three American heroes stopped a terrorist attack in Europe? They were members of the National Guard and Air Force, a testament to the U.S. military. Clint Eastwood also directed American Sniper about legendary Navy SEAL Chris Kyle. I'm glad to see these true stories of patriotism and bravery on the Big Screen.

The U.S. Army has identified Spc. Jeremy Darrell Tomlin, just 22, from Chapel Hill, Tennessee, as the soldier who died in a training accident in Maryland recently. Jeremy sacrificed his young life for our country. Two others are in critical condition. My heart goes out to them and their families.
Amazing find. Historians say the only one like it is the 1776 copy under glass at the US National Archives.

Warriors To The Workforce Nashville is a free career fair open to all U.S. military veterans, transitioning service members and military spouses. Dozens of employers will be at Gaylord Opryland Resort & Convention Center on April 27 and 28. There's still time to register. Visit the link to learn more!

Honor to judge the Region 6 Best Tasting Water Contest sponsored by The Tennessee Association of Utilities (TAUD). The drinking samples were judged on their clarity, bouquets, and taste. Congratulations Winchester Utilities! #TN04

Finally! Tennessee farmers and ranchers have been waiting for a new Agriculture Secretary to help alleviate the boom-and-bust agriculture cycle, susceptible to wild weather and unfair foreign trade practices. As a member of the House Agriculture Committee, I look forward to working with the first Southerner  to occupy the post in decades. Congratulations to Georgia's Sonny Perdue, the latest addition to Donald J. Trump's stellar cabinet.

U.S. News and World Report ranks Central Magnet School in Murfreesboro, Tennessee, the best school in the state -- and 10th best magnet school in the country. The school also ranks as one of the best to teach personal finance, something more should do! Proud to represent Rutherford County in Congress.

The American Health Care Act was a good start but not good enough. My Freedom Caucus colleagues and I fought for big changes, which will lower Tennesseans' health care costs. Our state can exempt itself from the worst Obamacare regulations; high-risk pools cover pre-existing conditions; the bill repeals individual and business taxes immediately; it repeals drug and medical device taxes, while expanding tax-free health savings accounts; and it controls Medicaid costs and punishes fraud.  But it's not the end. My friend Dr. Tom Price at U.S. Department of Health and Human Services is dismantling Obamacare, as President Donald J. Trump directed in an executive order. The President has been instrumental during this process. And I've sponsored other legislation to fulfill my promise to create a freer health care market, including more generic drugs, an end to insurance company monopolies, tort reform, and more tax reform. As a physician, husband and father, as well as former cancer patient, my highest priority in Congress is affordable, accessible, quality health care.

Portland, Oregon, canceled its Rose Parade, due to threats against Republicans. At UC Berkeley and other campuses, riots break out when a conservative speaks. The Left set fires and broke windows at Donald J. Trump's inauguration. It's one reason fed-up Americans elected him: free speech and assembly are under assault. The IRS even targeted religious groups!

The Iran nuclear deal. Benghazi. Destroying evidence of Clinton Foundation pay-to-play. Isolating Israel and paying off the terrorist-controlled Gaza "government." One of America's best executives, our new Secretary of State, is undertaking a necessary transformation of the State Department, where he's putting U.S. interests first.
Your Second Amendment rights are safe.

The Obama Administration's school lunch rules achieved the opposite of the intended effect. Rather than ingest unpalatable, paltry servings, students toss their lunches in the garbage, going hungry or to the convenience store. New rules, which have bipartisan backing, should give states more flexibility. The School Nutrition Association supports the change.

Spectacular view from the Ferris Wheel at The National Cornbread Festival in South Pittsburg, Tennessee. The winner: Chili shrimp and coconut cornbread. Already looking forward to next year! Hope to see you there.
Change.

With members of the House Armed Services Committee, which oversees military strategy, operations and budgets, I traveled to Eastern Europe to interview troops and their commanders, as well representatives of our foreign allies. I'm working on the Readiness Subcommittee to supply our brave fighting men and women with everything they need to keep our country safe.

With control of Congress and the White House, Republicans have an historic opportunity to enact conservative reforms, but surrendered to Democrats’ shutdown threats. Now is the time to keep our promises, not later, when the opposition will make the same threats. We don’t have time to waste, the reason I could not vote for this half measure.

I worked with the Freedom Caucus to improve the American Health Care Act, which will lower Tennesseans’ health care costs, thanks to state waivers we secured during tough negotiations. We’re helping President Donald J. Trump to fulfill his promise to the American people, suffering under Obamacare. It’s time for the Senate to do its job and help us deliver the President a bill to sign.

In 2008, small business deaths began to outpace start-ups for the first time. Congress and the President have slashed almost $100 billion of regulations curtailing jobs and growth. We're working on major tax reform to allow enterprising Americans to keep more of their hard-earned money and innovate, an important reminder during #SmallBusinessWeek.

Police feel under seige, which a new FBI report bears out. Fatal attacks on cops increased 56 percent last year, largely because of a surge of anti-cop rhetoric. More criminals resist arrest, and some with the encouragement of radical groups have carried out deadly attacks on police. They protect our safety and need our support.
Western Conference Finals! The Nashville Predators make Tennessee proud.

Dr. David Shulkin, the new secretary of Veterans Affairs, is NOT a bureaucrat. He’s a forward thinker, who’s won praise for turning around failing hospitals, and he’s willing to work in the trenches for Tennessee vets. Our state has one of the fastest-growing vet populations in the U.S., and they’re relying on an improved VA for care.

My actions on health care come from being a physician for 25 years and caring about people. We don’t have liberal diseases and conservative diseases. We just have diseases, and that’s the way I approach health care. We really worked hard on making this bill go even further to cover people with pre-existing conditions.

Aetna has exited Obamacare entirely. Without taxpayer bailouts, multiple insurers have already left Tennessee. People need help. I support the American Health Care Act to lower taxes, penalties and fees, increase consumer choice, and to better protect people with pre-existing conditions. The law strengthens Medicaid for those who need it. Millions are waiting for relief. The Senate must act!
The President's hard bargaining is paying off. Our NATO allies are committing more for their defense, as they're obligated to do under the treaty. The result will be a more secure Europe.

A win for Tennessee cattlemen. On the House Agriculture Committee, I'll hear more from Agriculture Secretary Sonny Perdue next week about unfair foreign trade practices. We're focused on rural prosperity, including eliminating the estate tax that hits family farms hard.

The new Tom Rowland Interchange, named for Cleveland, Tennessee's longest-serving mayor, delivers access to an industrial area that planners expect to create thousands of jobs. An honor to cut the ribbon on the next phase of economic development in Bradley County!
Happy Mother's Day. What are you doing for mom today? #ThanksMom
Under new management

We want trade deals that respect U.S. sovereignty and free, but fair trade.
